intro: Ichnocarpus afzelii, commonly known as the African burr bean, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and can thrive in arid environments. The plant's ability to fix nitrogen makes it an important component of ecosystems in its native range.
